sub_title: Senior ServiceNow Solution Architect at IBM
summary:
I am passionate about assisting organizations to leverage technology to improve their way of working and derive great satisfaction in seeing my work in action. I am enthusiastic about software engineering principles and keen on learning new technologies in the ever changing landscape of software engineering.

I have more than 12 years of experience in the IT industry, within the Banking and Financial Services and ITSM domain. Throughout, this period I have worked extensively with Java and associated technologies, javascript, ServiceNow etc.

I have worked in numerous roles, like as a scrum master, business analyst, solution designer, software developer, tester etc., and therefore, is familiar with varied aspects of running and executing a project.
I have good knowledge and experience in the Agile methodology of software development and working in scrums. 

My strengths are :
•	I have good leadership skills, enabling me to run activities of my team efficiently.
•	Good analytical and logical ability which helps me in solving problems with valuable technical solutions.
•	Good communication skills, of not only speaking but also of listening, which enables me to work with various teams and people from  different cultures, and drive them towards the necessary outcome.
•	I have a good eye for finding problems in a system, which helps me to guide the necessary stake holders in mitigating risks due to the problem or eliminating  the problem altogether.

Specialties: Business analysis, FPA, Use cases, ServiceNow, JAVA, Javascript, JDBC, Hibernate, XML, JUnit, UML, SQL, Logical and analytical ability, black box testing, test planning etc.

awards.title: Certificate of Appreciation
awards.description: Was recognized for efficient defect management with apt root cause analysis, and guiding the team to reduce / nullify defects in the software.

certifications.name: Micro-certification - Agile and Test Management Implementation
Certified Application Specialist - Performance Analytics (CAS - PA)

profile_positions.description:
As a senior manager and ServiceNow managed Service Lead for Benelux in Cognizant, I am responsible for the delivery of ServiceNow projects in Benelux. I have been the primary solution architect for several RFPs and have supported various projects as SME to present solutions to the customers.

From project implementation perspective I am leading 2 engagements as a solution architect.

1) Project Context:
The customer wants to bring global way of working into its company. In order to achieve that they have chosen ServiceNow as their platform. The project involves implementation of ITSM, ITOM and ITBM. 

Roles and responsibilities:
•	As a functional lead and technical architect of the project, I am responsible for collecting business requirements and design the implementation solution. 
•	As a delivery manager, I am responsible for planning and quality assurance of the deliverables.
•	As a project manager, I am responsible for resourcing and finances of the project. We have been able to achieve flexible and optimum resourcing based on demand from having 5 – 12 dedicated resources on the team.
•	As a senior development team member I take up development of complex requirements / provide guidance and support to the team members.
•	With a proactive approach I have been able to identify and remove bottlenecks in the processes and bring about automation wherever possible e.g. automated routing of tickets, automated KPI calculations, automation in user-group administration etc.

2) Project context - Customer wants to become SOX compliant by having all their assets in ServiceNow CMDB which will be then the single source of truth for the IT landscape. I am involved in the implementation as a ServiceNow architect for Cloud Asset discovery for hybrid cloud.
profile_positions.title: Senior Manager /ServiceNow Managed Services Lead Benelux/ ServiceNow Solutions Architect

profile_positions.description:
Project Context:
The customer (a leading European media company) wanted to revamp its ITSM processes, make the service portal easily navigable by the end users. They want to promote usage of self-service within the organization. 
As several services (Hosting, network, workplace, EUC, Service Desk etc.) were taken over by Accenture from the current incumbent vendor with additional scope of services, the project also involved addition of new services / applications to be implemented in ServiceNow.

Roles and responsibilities:
•	I am the ServiceNow technical lead and architect responsible for ITSM processes design and implementation (Incident, Problem, Service Request, Change, Knowledge, CMDB), technical design and implementation of several custom integrations using web services, CMDB integration using scheduled batch file import and SCCM integration. 
•	I am also involved in key design areas which are part of a future release phase - service portal, virtual agent and automation for request fulfilment. 
•	As part of being the technical lead I am responsible for reviewing all the project deliverables.
•	Responsible for creating the development plan including testing and release activities of the team.
•	I am also the point for co-ordination between the customer, our project team and the current ServiceNow support team (a different vendor).
profile_positions.title: ServiceNow Technical Architect and development lead (Associate Manager)

profile_positions.location: Amsterdam Area, Netherlands / Las Vegas, USA
profile_positions.description:
As part of ServiceNow Accenture partnership program I had been part of the group of trainers for the course ServiceNow Fundamentals and have served as an instructor on different classes.

I was also invited to the Knowledge'18 to be part of the teaching team as a TA for the ServiceNow Service mapping Fundamentals class delivered during the pre-conference period.
profile_positions.title: Trainer

profile_positions.description:
Project context:
The customer (a global tea and coffee company) implemented End User Services – Incident Management, Problem Management, Knowledge Management, End User Service Requests in ServiceNow. In addition to the mentioned modules various integrations through web services and SFTP interfaces are also in scope. The new ServiceNow Self-Service Portal has been implemented for users to use the IT Services of the organization.

Roles and responsibilities:
•	Co-ordinate and manage the development team responsible to deliver the project
•	Implement the ServiceNow modules customized with business requirements
•	Implement various web services integrations with different vendors
•	Define and design contractual SLRs
•	Implement Performance Analytics dashboards for new modules, suppliers, business services etc.
•	Implement SFTP interfaces with various vendors for exchange of data
•	Design Self-Service Portal
•	Perform knowledge transfer and transfer to support team
profile_positions.title: Software Development Team Lead / Scrum Master / Solution Designer/ Architect / Software Developer

profile_positions.description:
Project context:
The customer has a lot of configuration management data but was not very sure about where the gaps are, what pieces of the puzzle were missing, which CIs are orphans, how can the IT landscape be optimized etc. Configuring and creating dashboards for CMDB with performance analytics helped the customers to answer the above questions. In short it made the Configuration management data come to life.

Roles and responsibilities:
•	Analyze data and propose design visualizations of the data to help the customer understand their CMDB
•	Implement Performance Analytics Dashboards to visualize the data
profile_positions.title: Data Analytics / Performance Analytics Consultant at a major Dutch retailer

profile_positions.description:
Project context:
ServiceNow is a leading ITSM cloud solution, considered as a leader in its domain in Gartner's magic quadrant. The project comprises of implementing ServiceNow for streamlining the IT Services for the client.
For the first phase, we are implementing Service Catalog, Change management and CMDB.

Roles and responsibilities: 
•	Created a knowledge base for ServiceNow implemention
•	Created Interface design document where integrations with different interfaces like AD, ADFS, MID server, SCCM etc. have been described. This works as the working document while implementing the various integrations.
•	I am leading the creation of the CMDB data model and the tables as well, which will be used for configuration management within the organisation. This is a major challenge as the organization is new and is evolving the IT services.
•	I have implemented the ADFS integration for SSO and LDAP integration for user data. This involved defining transform maps, with custom scripts to map the data accurately and in a normalized form.
•	I have led numerous discussions with customers and internal as well regarding the agile way of working, driving the data model for CMDB, test management, implementation approach, scope etc.
•	Analyzing business needs and propose appropriate implementation approach.
•	Implementing solutions in ServiceNow.
•	Designed the service model for the new ServiceNow application within the client organization.
•	Designing and implementing the self-service portal using CMS, javascript, jelly, CSS etc. in ServiceNow.
•	Designing and implementing web services to integrate with various interfaces for incident, problem, change management and service requests.
•	Designing and implementing integration of the CMDB with various vendors.
•	Data analysis and quality improvement of CMDB.
profile_positions.title: Solution designer/architect / Software Developer / Scrum Master / Test coordinator

profile_positions.description: During this period I had driven a small program within the organization in the domain of IOT. I had worked on developing embedded applications using raspberry pi and Java Mobile Edition. I have made a few presentations and conducted sessions to generate interest amongst colleagues in this area, and also to provide guidance.
profile_positions.title: Developer / Trainer

profile_positions.description:
I was unallocated to any project, therefore, my responsibilities involved around providing expertise on Java to project teams within the organization and building competency on new technologies.
•	I have helped an Accenture team working with government department to implement Java applet in their application to open documents on a remote location as a Microsoft word file. I have also helped them with the security settings and code signing with certificates.
•	I have attended a 4 day intensive workshop in Paris, where I was introduced to COBOL and how to use the BluAge tool to migrate applications from legacy systems to modern architecture. I was part of a panel to make a decision for usage of the tool.
•	I have developed competency with RESTful web services, Spring Batch etc.
•	I have undergone trainings for scrum master, ServiceNow etc.
profile_positions.title: Software Engineering Team Lead

profile_positions.description:
The project comprised mainly of a middle layer for the securities processing chain and a Frontend for the local bank advisors of a large multinational bank. 
The middle layer has 3 modules :
Batch: It handles huge amount of data, coming from the back offices, or internal tables and processes them in chunks, as per the clients requirement and provides output files to various connecting interfaces. 
Online: It is a online service provider that handles requests from numerous interfaces and processes them to generate responses in accordance to Rabobank's requirement.
SDM: It is a front end, available to the management for static data maintenance.

Front end: The front end is used by the local bank advisors for various functions like placing an order for the customer, creating an account for the customer etc.
Apart from these there are other support projects for testing the online services and maintenance of the applications.
	
Assignments : Business analysis of new requirements, designing, development and testing of solutions comprising of new batch processes, web services, front ends etc., planning and release management of all modules, production support
profile_positions.title: I.T. Analyst

profile_positions.description: I have successfully completed the Initial Learning Program conducted for freshers at the company. The first phase was held in Gandhinagar, Gujarat, India, where focus was on logical ability with development on Dr.scheme and later in Java. There were also introductory sessions to prepare myself for the corporate world. The second phase was held in Mumbai, Maharashtra, India, where there was intensive training on Java.
profile_positions.title: Trainee

profile_positions.description:
Roles and responsibilities : 
Worked with customers directly to gather requirements pertaining to changes required in the customer’s business  model, for e.g. Introduction of a new service concept, Introduction of a new sales channel, new reports for customers etc.
Communicated with different teams in the project as well as external parties and other stake holders, like other impacted systems, different customer departments etc. to understand the requirements.
Understanding and categorizing the different business requirements, and formulating and proposing an effective solution, keeping in mind the customer’s needs as well as the time and budget.

Skills :

Impact analysis for new RFCs, Function point analysis, Use Case , UML, Functional Design Documents, Clear Quest, Clear Case, Astah UML tool.
profile_positions.title: Business Analyst (through TCS)

profile_positions.description: 24*7 Production support for resolving production incidents which involved analyzing incidents and proposing and implementing workarounds / hot fixes within a defined SLA.
profile_positions.title: Production Support Engineer (through TCS)

profile_positions.description:

Application Lead and onsite co-ordinator for Prisma Batch processes application.
Backup Application Lead and onsite co-ordinator for Prisma Online application.
Release management and Planning of requirements.

Skills:
Team management, Nexus, Clear Quest, Technical Design Document, Interface specification, Agile Poker planning
profile_positions.title: Onsite Co-ordinator / Application Lead (through TCS)

profile_positions.description:

Creating test plan for new customer requirements.
System testing, chain testing, functional testing and performance testing of the software.

Skills :
Black box testing, HP Quality Center, Test cases creation and execution, White box testing, Performance testing, Defect management and root cause analysis
profile_positions.title: Software Tester (through TCS)

profile_positions.description:
Roles and responsibilities :
Software development, Peer review, Unit Testing for realization of the customer's requirements.
Enhanced batch processes and online services with new client requirements and quality and performance improvement.
Reduced complexity in various process workflows, to improve maintainability of the system.

Skills:
Java, J2EE, HTML, XML, SQL, UML, Unix, Axis, Struts, JDBC, Hibernate, MDB, JUnit, DB2, WAS, Maven, TWS, MQ, Hudson, Jenkins, CVS, VSS, SVN, Git, Eclipse, RAD, XML Spy
profile_positions.title: Software Developer (through TCS)

profile_positions.description: For a brief period of 1- 2 months I took up additional responsibility as the scrum master of a team, since the scrum master was on leave. During this period, I conducted scrum ceremonies and facilitated the progress of the scrums. I was able to steer the team through sprints without affecting the velocity of the sprints. I took necessary actions to resolve impediments.
profile_positions.title: Scrum Master (via TCS)

volunteer_experiences.description: I have donated blood three times during this period, and was a donor who could be contacted for emergencies.
